meanings.definition: Sealed or closed with a lute.
meanings.sent1: The luted jar kept the contents fresh.
meanings.sent2: The luted lid prevented any leaks.
meanings.sent3: The luted box was so secure, even a squirrel couldn't open it!
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt luted, protected from any harm.
meanings.sent5: The luted door was like a fortress, keeping out all intruders.

meanings.definition: To seal or close with a lute.
meanings.sent1: She luted the pipes together to fix the leak.
meanings.sent2: The craftsman luted the pieces of pottery with care.
meanings.sent3: He luted the broken vase back together, good as new!
meanings.sent4: The chef luted the edges of the pie crust to seal in the filling.
meanings.sent5: The handyman luted the gaps in the window frame to keep out the cold.

meanings.definition: A substance used for sealing or closing.
meanings.sent1: The luted material filled the gap perfectly.
meanings.sent2: She applied the luted carefully to ensure a tight seal.
meanings.sent3: The luted was so sticky, it got stuck to his fingers!
meanings.sent4: The ancient Egyptians used luted to seal their tombs.
meanings.sent5: The luted was like magic, keeping everything in place.
